Package xyz.rk0cc.willpub.cmd.subcmd

Class PubSubCommand

java.lang.Object
xyz.rk0cc.willpub.cmd.subcmd.PubSubCommand
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractedPubSubCommand, PubSubCommandWithArgs
public abstract sealed class PubSubCommand extends Object permits AbstractedPubSubCommand, PubSubCommandWithArgs
An object representing subcommands in pub.
You can not inherit from this class directly when implementing new PubSubCommand, please follow the table depending on the subcommand structures:
Sub-abstract class Suitable for
AbstractedPubSubCommand A command without any arguments parse.
PubSubCommandWithArgs A command with arguments parse.
Since:
1.0.0
See Also:
  • pub subcommand documentation

  • Method Details

    • isEmptyOptions

      public final boolean isEmptyOptions()
      Check does this subcommand's option is empty.
      Returns:
      true if no PubOption applied.

    • addOption

      @Nonnull public final PubSubCommand addOption(@Nonnull PubOption option, boolean replaceIfExisted)
      Apply PubOption to this subcommand.
      Applied PubOption will be cloned and save internally.
      Parameters:
      option - A PubOption which pending to apply this subcommand.
      replaceIfExisted - Replace option data if applied PubOption is existed in this subcommand already.
      Returns:
      Same object of subcommand which allows chaining methods.
      Throws:
      IllegalSubCommandOptionException - If this subcommand applied unsupported PubOption.
      PerquisitesOptionsNotFoundException - Some PubOption has PubPerquisitesOptions which required either or both PubOption which mentioned in the perquisites. If applying PubOption without meeting requirement, this exception thrown.

    • addOption

      @Nonnull public final PubSubCommand addOption(@Nonnull PubOption option)
      Apply or replace if existed this option to this subcommand.
      Parameters:
      option - Specify which PubOption is applied into this subcommand.
      Returns:
      Current subcommand that allowing chaining methods.
      Throws:
      IllegalSubCommandOptionException - If this subcommand applied unsupported PubOption.
      PerquisitesOptionsNotFoundException - If applied specific PubOption does not meet perquisites requirement.
      See Also:
      • addOption(PubOption, boolean)

    • getOption

      @Nullable public final <O extends PubOption> O getOption(@Nonnull Class<O> option)
      Get applied PubOption in this subcommands.
      Type Parameters:
      O - Target type of PubOption.
      Parameters:
      option - Class of the PubOption.
      Returns:
      A PubOption with record when applied. Or null if not applied yet.

    • hasOption

      public final boolean hasOption(@Nonnull Class<? extends PubOption> option)
      Inspect PubOption Class is applied into this subcommand already or not.
      Parameters:
      option - Class of PubOption that want to inspect is existed in this subcommand or not.
      Returns:
      true if existed.

    • removeOption

      @Nonnull public final PubSubCommand removeOption(@Nonnull Class<? extends PubOption> optionType)
      Remove specific option in current subcommand.
      If remaining option annotated with PubPerquisitesOptions which required removed class, it will be removed automatically depending on PubPerquisitesOptions.policy().
      Parameters:
      optionType - A Class of PubOption that going to be removed.
      Returns:
      Same subcommand object that allow chaining methods.

    • clearOption

      @Nonnull public final PubSubCommand clearOption()
      Clear all applied option in this subcommand.
      Returns:
      Same object that allowing chaining methods.

    • buildSubCommand

      @Nonnull public abstract String buildSubCommand()
      Assemble String of this subcommand when executed.
      Returns:
      A String of pub subcommand.
